docs.text: upon arriving at the theater during the opening credits , i took my seat and prepared myself for what appeared to be " hellraiser meets the crow " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but as soon as kiefer sutherland began speaking the narrative monologue , describing " the strangers " and their reasons for contacting human beings , i was hooked .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there was something especially compelling about the nature of his voice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i knew from the start that i was going to witness the actions of his character rather than the actor attempting the character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sutherland played the role as a true veteran .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: upon the completion of his monologue , the camera arrives on sutherland in such a fashion that you can only wonder how long alex proyas spent on cinematography .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i would imagine , for a film of this caliber , that maximum hours of work were spent where they were needed the most .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film flowed beautifully .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as i was being taken through the intricate regions of the " dark city " , a clever plot began to unravel , to the point where the last time i had seen such clever plot twists were in " the usual suspects " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not to mention a series of special effects that would make james cameron literally turn green with envy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but if you're not exactly the biggest sci-fi fan , caveat emptor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: get ready for the atmostpheric darkness of " 12 monkeys " or " the crow " without the boredom or depression .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the concept of the plot is as mindstretching as " 12 monkeys " was , however , so be prepared and be sophisticated .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and imagine a picture that finally does justice to the comic-book-gone-feature-film fad that hollywood has recently become abusive of .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dark city simply puts " spawn " to shame .

docs.text: in fact , during the climax of the film i couldn't help but feel the strong presence of an " akira " -esque explosion throughout the general feeling of the movie .

docs.text: so my initial predictions were wrong .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this film is anything but the meloncholy of " hellraiser " parts one through five .

docs.text: i'm never one to base a film entirly on special effects , so know that when i give dark city
